ivardefs.name: data
ivardefs.desc: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.

ivardefs.name: onBehalfOf
ivardefs.desc: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.

ivardefs.name: sigFormat
ivardefs.desc: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

ivardefs.name: targetFormat
ivardefs.desc: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.

ivardefs.name: type_
ivardefs.desc: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

ivardefs.name: when
ivardefs.desc: When the digital signature was signed.

ivardefs.name: who
ivardefs.desc: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).

properties.desc: Base StructureDefinition for Signature Type: A signature along with supporting context. The signature may be a digital signature that is cryptographic in nature, or some other signature acceptable to the domain. This other signature may be as simple as a
